reviewText: I did not notice it said documentary , and i kept expecting the complete ballet, but it was a wonderful education on Nureyev and the way dancers have to live their roles, but i am still  will buy the performance, Be careful to note in this dvd,  it is not the ballet, it is a documentary on the dancers, the choreography, interesting, pretty...but...

Before you buy, be advised that this a documentary, not a full length ballet.  It follows the Paris Opera Ballet as Nureyev sets Raymonda for them.  It is almost all behind the scenes studio work.  After the initial setting of the ballet, the documentary follows a resetting ten years later.  At this point, the producers seamlessly weave clips from different dancers performing the same roles and their coaching of the younger dancers.  If you know what to expect, you'll love it.

2/13/13:  If you enjoy this, you'll love the similar presentation of La Bayadere.

All four DANCER'S DREAM documentary's (Romeo and Juliet, Sleeping Beauty, Raymonda and La Bayadere) are now available in a box set: Dancer's Dream: Great Ballets of Rudolf Nureyev. BRAVO! Reality t.v for the ballet obsessed.
